timeline.bodyText:
If someone has okapi.proxy.tenants.post permission and therefore is allowed to use POST /_/proxy/modules with one module at a time why should they not do exactly the same thing with a list of modules?
My suggestion is to avoid this new permission and reuse okapi.proxy.tenants.post.
timeline.author: julianladisch

         + "    \"permissionsRequired\" : [ \"okapi.discovery.nodes.get\"  ], "
         + "    \"type\" : \"internal\" "
         + "   }, "
+        // import modules
+        + "   {"
+        + "    \"methods\" :  [ \"POST\" ],"
+        + "    \"pathPattern\" : \"/_/proxy/import/modules\","
+        + "    \"permissionsRequired\" : [ \"okapi.import.modules.post\" ], "

replies.bodyText: Not what we typically, do. But ok.

timeline.bodyText:
If we decide that we need a new permission.
Then we should

use a permission name the reflects the similarity to okapi.proxy.tenants.post
copy the wording we use in the raml file.

Example:
"permissionName" : "okapi.proxy.tenants.post-list"
"displayName" : "Okapi - announce new modules to proxy"
"description" : "Announce a list of new modules to the proxy"
